properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 8:56AM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Warning
for the following rivers in Mississippi...

Pearl River near Lena affecting Leake County
Pearl River Near Ratliff's Ferry affecting Madison and Rankin
Counties

...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the
following rivers in Mississippi...
Pearl River Above Philadelphia affecting Neshoba County
Yockanookany River Near Ofahoma affecting Leake County
Pearl River At Edinburg affecting Leake County
Pearl River Near Carthage affecting Leake County

The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Pearl River Near Ratliff's Ferry
* from Wednesday evening until further notice.
* At 8:15 AM Monday the stage was 298.7 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 303.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage Wednesday evening
and will continue to rise to near 306.0 feet Sunday morning.
* Flood history...This crest compares to a previous crest of 306.0
feet on Mar 15 2016.
* Impact...At 306.0 feet...Overbank flooding is occurring along
the reach of the river.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive or walk through areas where water covers roadway! The
water may be deeper than it appears. Remember...Turn around, don't
drown!

Please note that forecast crests are based upon rainfall that has
occurred along with forecast rainfall for the next 24 hours. Rainfall
amounts greater than forecast may take the rivers higher.

Additional information is available at:
https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN

The next regularly scheduled update is expected tonight between 8 and
10 PM.
